elements.title: congressional office lottery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the congressional office lottery has involved a "Jedi mind trick", head rubs, and push-ups (pictured)?

elements.title: Sunday (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Snoop Dogg's original lyrics about cannabis for the song "Sunday" were sung over by Ben Rector to keep the song clean?

elements.title: Sophie von Maltzan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sophie von Maltzan led the making of a submarine that was walked through the streets of Dublin?

elements.title: Sealord Group (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the New Zealand fishing company Sealord Group is half-owned by iwi?

elements.title: Carlos Scharff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that rubber barons like Carlos Scharff enslaved indigenous populations in the Upper Amazon region during the rubber boom as a workforce for latex collection?

elements.title: Greco-Australian dialect (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Greco-Australian dialect, a variety of Modern Greek, blends words with English roots into the Greek language?

elements.title: Harry Crosbie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dublin property developer Harry Crosbie received an OBE from the British ambassador to Ireland, partly for entertaining Elizabeth II with his showbiz contacts?

elements.title: Luochahai City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the song "Luochahai City" mentions Ludwig Wittgenstein?
